Product Name: Intel Core i3-14100 Desktop Processor 4 cores (4 P-cores + 0 E-cores) up to 4.7 GHz
Review Text: Fast and runs cool. Very good graphics for CPU. Can game as long as you pair it with discrete GPU.

Product Name: Intel Core i3-14100 Desktop Processor 4 cores (4 P-cores + 0 E-cores) up to 4.7 GHz
Review Text: Upgrading from i5 6600. My new i3 is so cute im going to nickname it AWESOME! The cooler is very elegant. I hope it works! Thanks! Amazon for fast shipping arriving a day early and packaged nice!I was really excited about the cooler but the mounting mechanism is aweful. It dont clip dont nice now matter how hard i tried. Theres always one last clip just loose. I can reach on the backside and pop it off easily with my finger. I can understand people on a budget and needs to rely on this cooler and intel provides, Thanks! but i switched over to a cheap waterblock and i felt way more at ease.Intel skimped on the thermal paste. upon first installation i tried a game and it throttled my cpu with turbo boost on. I took the cooler off to try another cooler and looked at the paste it barely cover the cpu.I added more paste on top of intel paste and got a 15c drop and no more throttle. If you dont have better cooling solution i advise you get more thermal paste for sure.I test CPU on game COD MW3 before with intel 6600 i get 35-50fps with a lot of micro stutter.now with new intel i3 its getting 80-120fps smooth. and the fps counter saying its only using about 10-15 % cpu activity! im very happy. Thanks!

Product Name: Intel Core I9-14900K LGA 1700 New Gaming Desktop Processor 24 Cores (8 P-Cores + 16 E-Cores) with Integrated Graphics - Unlocked
Review Text: I bought it with a 10% discount, it is the best processor I have had. It doesn't complain about anything, although it is very hot, yes. But with good liquid cooling, which is already quite good, it is controlled. I liked it a lot, without detracting from the AMD competition that is doing great too. But in my case, since DDR5 memories are optimized for Intel and I don't want to be struggling, I decided on this one and I don't regret my purchase. Very good product of premium quality.

Product Name: Intel Core I9-14900K LGA 1700 New Gaming Desktop Processor 24 Cores (8 P-Cores + 16 E-Cores) with Integrated Graphics - Unlocked
Review Text: good decision for my computer

Product Name: Intel Core I9-14900K LGA 1700 New Gaming Desktop Processor 24 Cores (8 P-Cores + 16 E-Cores) with Integrated Graphics - Unlocked
Review Text: I was using a 10700K. I decided it was time..well, actually I got the itch.I decided to go with the 14700K for a few reasons. One is that it's the only 14th gen part from Intel that got a significant upgrade (four more e-cores and 8 more threads, plus a small clock boost).I also don't like that the 3DFX part from AMD had caused some minor issues for people, and I definitely don't like the RAM issues I see all the time on AMD systems. If it wasn't for the RAM issues, I may have gone AMD this time. Out of all the Intel systems I have assembled for customers over the years, I have not once come across a RAM issue that wasn't caused by bad RAM.This CPU is working perfectly, and gaming excellently. Gaming benchmarks show it to be a very good CPU, and I am not having any issues with it.If you are interested in any other Intel parts, I suggest going with 13th gen as you will basically get the same part for less money. For an i7 system though, this is an excellent CPU and a half decent upgrade over the previous gen.

Product Name: IntelÂ® Coreâ„¢ i9-14900KS Desktop Processor 24 cores (8 P-cores + 16 E-cores)
Review Text:
The Intel® Core™ i9-14900KS Desktop Processor arrives with much anticipation, boasting impressive specifications on paper. However, a closer examination reveals that this processor falls short of delivering the expected value for its price tag.

At first glance, the i9-14900KS appears promising, with its high clock speeds and purported performance enhancements. However, when put to the test, it becomes evident that the marginal improvements over its predecessors do not justify the hefty price premium attached to it.

One of the major drawbacks of the i9-14900KS is its lackluster performance gains in real-world scenarios. Despite the incremental upgrades in clock speeds and architecture, users may find that the difference in performance compared to previous generations is negligible in most tasks, from gaming to content creation.

Moreover, the i9-14900KS faces stiff competition from rival processors, such as those from AMD's Ryzen lineup, which offer comparable performance at a more reasonable price point. In terms of value for money, the i9-14900KS simply does not measure up, as consumers can find better alternatives that provide similar or even superior performance without breaking the bank.

Furthermore, the i9-14900KS's power consumption and thermal management remain areas of concern. Despite being marketed as a high-performance processor, it tends to run hot under heavy workloads, requiring robust cooling solutions to prevent thermal throttling and maintain stable operation.

In conclusion, while the Intel® Core™ i9-14900KS Desktop Processor may appeal to enthusiasts seeking the latest and greatest hardware, its lack of significant performance improvements and unfavorable price-to-performance ratio makes it a hard sell for the average consumer. With more cost-effective options available on the market, investing in the i9-14900KS may not be the wisest decision for those looking to maximize their computing power without breaking the bank.

Product Name: IntelÂ® Coreâ„¢ i9-14900KS Desktop Processor 24 cores (8 P-cores + 16 E-cores)

Unlocked to 6.2 GHz with a max temperature in-game around 54°C, obviously depending on the scenarios in Cyberpunk 2077, Horizon Zero Dawn, and Starfield. Product Name: Intel Core I7-14700K LGA 771 New Gaming Desktop Processor 20 Cores (8 P-Cores + 12 E-Cores) with Integrated Graphics - Unlocked
Review Text: I was using a 10700K. I decided it was time..well, actually I got the itch.I decided to go with the 14700K for a few reasons. One is that it's the only 14th gen part from Intel that got a significant upgrade (four more e-cores and 8 more threads, plus a small clock boost).I also don't like that the 3DFX part from AMD had caused some minor issues for people, and I definitely don't like the RAM issues I see all the time on AMD systems. If it wasn't for the RAM issues, I may have gone AMD this time. Out of all the Intel systems I have assembled for customers over the years, I have not once come across a RAM issue that wasn't caused by bad RAM.This CPU is working perfectly, and gaming excellently. Gaming benchmarks show it to be a very good CPU, and I am not having any issues with it.If you are interested in any other Intel parts, I suggest going with 13th gen as you will basically get the same part for less money. For an i7 system though, this is an excellent CPU and a half decent upgrade over the previous gen.

Review Text: I am normally an AMD person but recently ended up with an Intel custom rig. It had a low end intel CPU to start and I figured i would just upgrade to this instead of switching over to AMD again. Works wonderfully and it got rid of a bottleneck with the old CPU.

Product Name: Intel Core i7-14700F Desktop Processor 20 cores (8 P-cores + 12 E-cores) up to 5.4 GHz
Review Text: Everything arrived excellent, fast, and well cared for.

Product Name: Intel Core i7-14700F Desktop Processor 20 cores (8 P-cores + 12 E-cores) up to 5.4 GHz
Review Text: This latest i7 Intel chip is fast ,this 14th Gen chip is a worthy upgrade . Luv it !

Product Name: Intel Core i7-14700F Desktop Processor 20 cores (8 P-cores + 12 E-cores) up to 5.4 GHz
Review Text: I ordered 14700F because I need a CPU that has similar performance compared with 14700k but consumes less power, and I was wrong about it.1st of all, the CPU cooler come with the CPU is too weak and it limit the CPU to 65w with continuously load.The 65w power limitation severely undercut CPU performance and I get about 20,000 with Cinebench R23.A powerful cooler is definitely needed to cool down the CPU allowing it to run at 220w.With 220w on the 14700F, Cinebench R23 score has reached 33,000.For me, when 14700f paired with the original cooler, the 65w CPU is too weak for my need.In the meantime, with a powerful cooler, 14700f performs close (but not as fast) as 14700k and the 220w power consumption is not much difference compared with 14700kf's 250w PL2.Considering the price between 14700f and 14700kf, there is not much wattage difference between them.With this reason, I have decided to return it.Bottom line,For a price conscious buyer, then I think I5 is better choice because it is cheaper but performs similar compared to 14700f run at 65 watt.If you need more computing power like me, then I think14700k is a better buy.

Product Name: Intel CoreTM i5-14600K LGA 1700 Socket New Gaming Desktop Processor 14 (6 P-cores + 8 E-cores) with Integrated Graphics - Unlocked

Product Name: Intel Core i5-14500 Desktop Processor 14 cores (6 P-cores + 8 E-cores) up to 5.0 GHz
Review Text: When using the software interface, starting from the script, it immediately recognizes the handler, any round trips, eliminates them all, and the CPU temperature of three to four cores rises close to 100°C, and the feathers go up, that's about it.

Product Name: Intel Core i5-14500 Desktop Processor 14 cores (6 P-cores + 8 E-cores) up to 5.0 GHz
Review Text: This is a great product at a great price that runs cool with the included cooler. However, every motherboard manufacturer is now OVER VOLTING the CPUs causing them to run hotter and be less efficient so they can pass benchmarks with slightly higher scores at the cost of cooking your CPU. Look up the PL1 (long term power) and PL2 (short term power) ratings for your CPU and compare it to the massive over-volting your motherboard is doing to it without your knowledge or consent.In this case, the PL1 on a 14500 is 65w and the PL2 is 154w. My AsRock board was over-volting this to 219w+!!! No wonder it was cooking the CPU. This is not even an over-clockable CPU!There is a setting in the AsRock BIOS EZ screen to ENABLE INTEL POWER LIMITS, but it does not work! You need to go to advanced settings and find the long and short power limits and put them back MANUALLY to Intel's specifications.Now your chip will not over-heat, will cost less money to run, will last longer, be more reliable and you do NOT need to waste your money on more expensive coolers or thermal paste, nor waste your time installing and wiring all that up!!!!!!!

Product Name: Intel Core i5-14500 Desktop Processor 14 cores (6 P-cores + 8 E-cores) up to 5.0 GHz
Review Text: The CPU performs great.  Good price.  Probably not for gaming, but I'm not a gamer.The cooler is not sufficient for this CPU.  I had to buy a better one.  I am happy with this one:ID-COOLING SE-224-XTS CPU Cooler 4 Heatpipes CPU Air Cooler 120mm PWM Fan CPU Fan for Intel LGA1700/115X/1200; AMD AM4/AM5I wish Intel would not include the cooler and give the false impression that it will be fine.  Don't cook your CPU; just buy a better one.

Product Name: Intel Core i5-14500 Desktop Processor 14 cores (6 P-cores + 8 E-cores) up to 5.0 GHz

Review Text: good decision for my computer

Product Name: Intel Core I7-14700Kf LGA 1700 New Gaming Desktop Processor 20 Cores (8 P-Cores + 12 E-Cores) - Unlocked
Review Text: I was using a 10700K. I decided it was time..well, actually I got the itch.I decided to go with the 14700K for a few reasons. One is that it's the only 14th gen part from Intel that got a significant upgrade (four more e-cores and 8 more threads, plus a small clock boost).I also don't like that the 3DFX part from AMD had caused some minor issues for people, and I definitely don't like the RAM issues I see all the time on AMD systems. If it wasn't for the RAM issues, I may have gone AMD this time. Out of all the Intel systems I have assembled for customers over the years, I have not once come across a RAM issue that wasn't caused by bad RAM.This CPU is working perfectly, and gaming excellently. Gaming benchmarks show it to be a very good CPU, and I am not having any issues with it.If you are interested in any other Intel parts, I suggest going with 13th gen as you will basically get the same part for less money. For an i7 system though, this is an excellent CPU and a half decent upgrade over the previous gen.

Review Text: The Intel Core i9 13900K is an absolute powerhouse! Its blazing speeds and unrivaled performance have transformed my computing experience. Product Name: Intel Core i9-13900K Desktop Processor LGA 1700 24 cores (8 P-cores + 16 E-cores) 36M Cache, up to 5.8 GHz'
Review Text: It is working almost same as my 10 yr old DELL XPS laptop, swapped with a SATA SSD, and i7 second gen processor. I don't know whats improved. But it's doing its job I guess.. in my 2 weeks of usage I have seen it's temprature rised above 80Â°C once. Wasn't expecting that from current refined and powerful generations. I am using liquid cooling on top of this. And yet it hit 80Â°C. What I was doing when that happened was trying to open a game. And one thing that I missed was to disable the integrated graphics because I have dedicated GPU. It was just for a moment the CPU was used during the game launch and after it started using the GPU. But until that switch happened, under less than a minute of CPU usage, it reached to 80Â°c. I mean since these are premium products, there should be some protection layers blocking such usages, and close the programs instead rather than hitting its performance.But anyways, I disabled the integrated device and then it's all smooth. Everything normal except for that one instance explained above. Parallel processing is still shitty though with Windows OS. Same kind of processors on Mac before Apple silicon came in were working more efficiently. So I guess it's prob with windows OS, but not processors.

Product Name: Intel Core i9-13900K Desktop Processor LGA 1700 24 cores (8 P-cores + 16 E-cores) 36M Cache, up to 5.8 GHz'
Review Text: I love it, works great. I paired this with 128GB using G.SKILL Ripjaws S5 Series (Intel XMP 3.0) DDR5 RAM 64GB (2x32GB) 5600MT/s CL28-34-34-89 1.35V Desktop Computer Memory UDIMM - Matte Black (F5-5600J2834F32GX2-RS5K), this is the fasted 5600 MT/s DDR5 I could find on Amazon at the time of purchase and I specifically chose the 5600 MT/s because as it is advertised on Intel's website for the i9-13900k. It works really good, very very fast, and can ***multi task heavy software like they're nothing*** and with a push pull AIO it averages around 28*C and when I'm gaming it stays around 50-40*C with graphics maxed out. Much love and gratitude to Intel! This works great with gaming and also data science, which work is the main reason I bought this. I also used the Thermal Grizzly - KryoSheet (38x38x0,2mm) for this as well so I don't have to worry about paste drying up on my i9 <3 and lemmy tell you it fits PERFECTLY and pairs well with a CPU contact frame too, and after almost half a year I've yet to have any problems, only good results.

Review Text:
The media could not be loaded.
                
After more than 10 years with a Core i7, I decided to upgrade to this processor, and it is amazing.

Product Name: Intel Core i9-13900K Desktop Processor LGA 1700 24 cores (8 P-cores + 16 E-cores) 36M Cache, up to 5.8 GHz'
Review Text:
I waited for this generation to upgrade my 8th Generation build, which was running at 5100MHz, and now I'm simply happy with the performance of the i9-13900k processor, which reached speeds of 6200MHz (see attached image). I used an ASUS Z690-F motherboard, which did NOT recognize the memory (I used 64GB Corsair at 5200MHz); the machine simply wouldn't boot and the orange light on the motherboard indicated DRAM issues. After much reading, I found that it was necessary to update the BIOS using the rear FLASHBACK port. Once that was done, the operation was successful and I haven't had any major issues.

I installed a 120mm Cooler Master Lite radiator to control the processor because, incredibly, the KRAKEN x73 360mm was not able to keep the temperatures in check. The 120mm Cooler Master keeps the processor between 32 and 40 degrees with minimal load, and at maximum load and tests, it hits 80 degrees, which is simply great considering the maximum temperature of the processor is 125 degrees. I attached two Noctua fans at 3000 RPM in a push/pull configuration to the radiator.

I have several Linux/Oracle 12c and 19c RAC labs using GRID in storage and have set up 6 virtual machines (3 RACs) working excellently with more than excellent response speeds. Therefore, I highly recommend the 13th Gen i9 processor for any needs you may have. I'm happy with my purchase, and at the time of purchase, the cost was around 600 dollars!

Product Name: IntelÂ® Coreâ„¢ i9-14900K New Gaming Desktop Processor 24 cores (8 P-cores + 16 E-cores) with Integrated Graphics - Unlocked
Review Text: This processor is not plug and play, I'm not sure how true this is but I read that 70% of processors are not stable at default settings, and it's not Intel's fault but rather the motherboards that unlock voltages consuming up to 400w when Intel locks at around 250w, having said that if you don't have a custom setup you can't use it at more than 5.5 GHz. With a Be Quiet! Silent Loop 360 cooler, I use it at 5.5 GHz P-core and 4.0 E-core with about 1.280v, temperatures in Cinebench reach 90 degrees in summer for a score of 38k, in winter it stays around 80 degrees, in games during summer it ranges from 60 to 72 depending on the game, never reaching 80 degrees in-game. And it consumes between 90 and 130w.

Product Name: IntelÂ® Coreâ„¢ i9-14900K New Gaming Desktop Processor 24 cores (8 P-cores + 16 E-cores) with Integrated Graphics - Unlocked
Review Text: Easy to install if you know what you're doing. Be careful to not bend or break the pins. Apply thermal paste any way you like, thare is no "best" way - I go with an X pattern. The most important part is to ensure an even spread of paste on the dye, without any air gaps. You  can test how good your coverage is by applying the paste in any pattern you like, sit and press the cooler on the dye, then remove it and examine. If the spread/coverage looks good, clean the processor and cooler dyes, reapply paste, reseat and mount the cooler.

Product Name: IntelÂ® Coreâ„¢ i9-14900K New Gaming Desktop Processor 24 cores (8 P-cores + 16 E-cores) with Integrated Graphics - Unlocked
Review Text: My use is gaming PC - that said the i9 14900k was a absolute amazing CPU for the first 2 months. My specs are as followsI9 14900k @5.6ghzH100i 360mm all in one idle 28c/underload 40c48gb 6000mhz ramMSI 3090ti Suprem X 24gbNow to begin with this was a beast of a CPU and then 2 months later without any updates going in that changed.MW3 was plagued with Directx Errors/constant crashes. Helldivers2 wouldn't boot. I was offline for 6 days which is alot of time trying to find a fault with your pc when you ain't finding it. I have now found a work around that makes games play but now the CPU has to be underclocked to handle games - I know this doesn't make sense but intel are aware of the defect and it affects the 13900k also.Be sure to have a good look online as I am looking to return mine to manufacturer due to not being as described. Having g to underclock it to be useful is not what I purchased.Good luck and I hope this review helps you!

Product Name: IntelÂ® Coreâ„¢ i9-14900K New Gaming Desktop Processor 24 cores (8 P-cores + 16 E-cores) with Integrated Graphics - Unlocked
Review Text: This CPU is incredible in terms of power; I'm forced to throttle it to 125V because otherwise, it overheats and causes bluescreens/crashes, even with my watercooling setup. This just shows how intense this product is. Even throttled and paired with an RTX 4080 Super, there are no issues with lag or FPS. I use this combo with a 21:9 ultra-wide LED screen in 4K HDR at 100 fps, and all my games, multimedia, and background tasks run smoothly, thanks to its 24 cores keeping my framerate maxed out on all the most demanding games. I highly recommend it for multitasking, gaming (minimum 4K), video editing, etc. Thank you, Intel, for this delicious chicken! 🍗 🥳

Review Text: Fast and runs cool. Very good graphics for CPU. Can game as long as you pair it with discrete GPU.

Product Name: Intel Core i3-14100 Desktop Processor 4 cores (4 P-cores + 0 E-cores) up to 4.7 GHz
Review Text: Upgrading from i5 6600. My new i3 is so cute im going to nickname it AWESOME! The cooler is very elegant. I hope it works! Thanks! Amazon for fast shipping arriving a day early and packaged nice!I was really excited about the cooler but the mounting mechanism is aweful. It dont clip dont nice now matter how hard i tried. Theres always one last clip just loose. I can reach on the backside and pop it off easily with my finger. I can understand people on a budget and needs to rely on this cooler and intel provides, Thanks! but i switched over to a cheap waterblock and i felt way more at ease.Intel skimped on the thermal paste. upon first installation i tried a game and it throttled my cpu with turbo boost on. I took the cooler off to try another cooler and looked at the paste it barely cover the cpu.I added more paste on top of intel paste and got a 15c drop and no more throttle. If you dont have better cooling solution i advise you get more thermal paste for sure.I test CPU on game COD MW3 before with intel 6600 i get 35-50fps with a lot of micro stutter.now with new intel i3 its getting 80-120fps smooth. and the fps counter saying its only using about 10-15 % cpu activity! im very happy. Thanks!

Product Name: Intel Core i3-13100 Desktop Processor 4 cores (4 P-cores + 0 E-cores) 12MB Cache, up to 4.5 GHz
Review Text: The 13th Generation Intel® Core™ i3 processors offer robust performance with four total cores and a base frequency of 3.40 GHz, capable of reaching up to 4.50 GHz with Turbo Boost. They feature 12 MB of Intel® Smart Cache and 5 MB of L2 Cache, operating within a power range of 60 W to 110 W. These processors support a maximum memory size of 192 GB, with memory types including DDR5 up to 4800 MT/s and DDR4 up to 3200 MT/s across two memory channels. Integrated Intel® UHD Graphics 730 provides a base frequency of 300 MHz, dynamically scaling up to 1.5 GHz. The processors utilize Direct Media Interface (DMI) Revision 4.0 with up to 8 lanes, designed for scalability in single-socket configurations. They support PCI Express Revision 5.0 and 4.0, offering configurations up to 1x16+4 or 2x8+4 lanes for enhanced connectivity and bandwidth.

Product Name: Intel Core i3-13100 Desktop Processor 4 cores (4 P-cores + 0 E-cores) 12MB Cache, up to 4.5 GHz
Review Text: Hello,So I bought this processor to replace my ryzen 7 2700x that finally decided to die on me. I have had the ryzen since launch.I was expecting similar performance maybe slightly better. However, this i5-13400f not only performs better than my old ryzen. It also does it at much cooler temps then the ryzen put out. My ryzen idled at 35c and got up to around 79c on heavy load. The i5 idles at 22c and has only gotten as high as 55c max under heavy land. That's 13 degrees cooler than the ryzen at idle and 24 degrees cooler under load.With that said that's a huge improvement over my old ryzen. Which I shouldn't be surprised that ryzen is a few generations old now. But damn. Definitely worth grabbing one.My old ryzen would get bogged down if I created a video game asset in blender around if I went too crazy. So far the i5 hasn't been bothered by anything I do in blender. Or in zbrush, maya, 3ds max, or substance painter.

Product Name: Intel Core i3-14100 Desktop Processor 4 cores (4 P-cores + 0 E-cores) up to 4.7 GHz
Review Text: Upgrading from i5 6600. My new i3 is so cute im going to nickname it AWESOME! The cooler is very elegant. I hope it works! Thanks! Amazon for fast shipping arriving a day early and packaged nice!I was really excited about the cooler but the mounting mechanism is aweful. It dont clip dont nice now matter how hard i tried. Theres always one last clip just loose. I can reach on the backside and pop it off easily with my finger. I can understand people on a budget and needs to rely on this cooler and intel provides, Thanks! but i switched over to a cheap waterblock and i felt way more at ease.Intel skimped on the thermal paste. upon first installation i tried a game and it throttled my cpu with turbo boost on. I took the cooler off to try another cooler and looked at the paste it barely cover the cpu.I added more paste on top of intel paste and got a 15c drop and no more throttle. If you dont have better cooling solution i advise you get more thermal paste for sure.I test CPU on game COD MW3 before with intel 6600 i get 35-50fps with a lot of micro stutter.now with new intel i3 its getting 80-120fps smooth. and the fps counter saying its only using about 10-15 % cpu activity! im very happy. Thanks!

Product Name: Intel Core i5-13600K Desktop Processor 14 cores (6 P-cores + 8 E-cores) 24M Cache, up to 5.1 GHz' Socket LGA 1700
Review Text: The Intel Core i5-13600K (Latest Gen) Desktop Processor is a true powerhouse, delivering unparalleled performance with its 14 cores, consisting of 6 P-cores and 8 E-cores. This processor has far exceeded my expectations, providing seamless multitasking and blazing-fast performance for all my computing needs.The standout feature of the Intel Core i5-13600K is its 14 cores, making it one of the most powerful processors in its class. The 6 primary cores (P-cores) are designed for single-threaded tasks and applications, ensuring lightning-fast responsiveness and smooth user experience. Additionally, the 8 efficient cores (E-cores) cater to multithreaded workloads, providing exceptional multitasking capabilities and maximizing productivity.With the latest generation technology, the i5-13600K unleashes the true potential of Intel's cutting-edge processor architecture. Whether I'm gaming, streaming, video editing, or running intensive software applications, this processor handles it all with ease.The integrated graphics of the i5-13600K eliminate the need for a discrete graphics card for everyday tasks and light gaming, providing a cost-effective and space-saving solution for those who don't require dedicated graphics processing.The unlocked multiplier of this processor allows for easy overclocking, making it an excellent choice for enthusiasts and gamers who want to push their system's performance even further.I appreciate the low power consumption of the i5-13600K despite its impressive performance, contributing to energy efficiency and reduced operating costs.The Intel Core i5-13600K is compatible with the latest motherboard chipsets, ensuring seamless integration and future upgradability.Intel is a trusted brand known for producing high-quality processors, and the i5-13600K continues that legacy, providing a reliable and stable computing experience.In conclusion, the Intel Core i5-13600K (Latest Gen) Desktop Processor with its 14 cores is a performance beast, capable of handling the most demanding computing tasks with ease. Its balanced combination of P-cores and E-cores, unlocked multiplier, integrated graphics, and energy efficiency make it an ideal choice for power users and gamers alike. If you're looking to unleash the full potential of your desktop, the Intel Core i5-13600K is the ultimate processor that won't disappoint. I highly recommend this processor for its outstanding performance and the incredible multitasking capabilities it brings to my computing experience!

Product Name: Intel Core i5-13500 Processor, LGA 1700, 24M Cache, up to 4.80 GHz
Review Text:
It translates to: "I recently bought the Intel Core i5-13500 processor and overall, I'm satisfied with its performance. Firstly, this processor delivers solid performance for daily tasks and gaming. Single-core performance is good, and its multithreaded capability efficiently handles heavier workloads. I've noticed a significant improvement compared to my old processor, resulting in a smoother and more responsive experience.

However, I must point out that the price of this processor is a bit high for 2023. With technology evolving rapidly, it's possible to find processors offering similar performance at a lower price. If you're looking for a budget-friendly option, it might be wise to consider other options on the market.

Additionally, it's important to note that this processor is based on the Alder Lake architecture, which is relatively new. This means there may be compatibility issues or adjustments needed for certain older software or games. Make sure to check compatibility with your setup before purchasing.

In conclusion, the Intel Core i5-13500 processor offers satisfactory performance for daily tasks and gaming. However, the high price compared to other options on the market and potential compatibility issues are factors to consider. If you're willing to invest in a latest-generation processor, this one will meet your performance needs, but it may be prudent to explore other options if you're looking for better value for money

Product Name: Intel Core i5-13500 Processor, LGA 1700, 24M Cache, up to 4.80 GHz
Review Text: Processor with a quality-price ratio that shines like Olympus: a beast that tries any application or game or work that you need. Also as temperature we are (if activated in the BIOS the E-CORE starts to heat up ... also if used in a tower heatsink with two fans I have never exceeded 85 degrees, not even in this deep space). Be careful to set the BIOS for this beast, I have written some things to do to avoid problems: 1) pay attention to the CPU power profile, it will be like having a PL1 of 115w and a PL2 of 254w (depends on the producer of the mother board, but good or bad and values ​​are these), the processor as it seems... I set the INTEL profile (found among those available in the bios), such as PL1 65w and PL2 154w and testing I reach not to have personal performance in any mode (at most 2/3fps at least but sleep at night the same). 2) IF YOU HAVE AMD GPU: to activate the RESIZABLE BAR in the bios you must first enable the voice ''above 4g decoding'', make the pc always access the bios and then activate the ''resizable bar''... if not, it may happen that the card does not risk applying in contemporary modifications of these two variables will be blocked in a BOOTLOOP (to do this you just need to reset the BIOS by short-circuiting two pins on the motherboard). Otherwise, the excellent CPU is very satisfied.

Product Name: Intel Core I5-13600K Processor 24M Cache, Up to 5.10 Ghz, LGA 1700
Review Text:
My PC was getting old, and I wanted to upgrade it. I planned to replace the CPU with onboard graphics, the memory (DDR5), and the motherboard. I intended to keep the HDD, SSD, power supply, and case in the setup. I've had very good experiences in the past with an Intel CPU with integrated graphics. Since I'm not a gamer but mainly work with audio and video editing, I consciously decided against a dedicated graphics card and preferred to use the CPU's graphics capabilities. I invested the money saved in the CPU.

After intensive research online and considering my budget, I chose the Intel Core i5 13600K CPU. Various intensive tests showed a very good price-to-performance ratio within my planned budget range. Even more expensive i7 and i9 CPUs couldn't match its performance.

After over two months of intensive use, I have a very positive conclusion. For the integrated Intel UHD graphics, I installed Intel ARCS as recommended. According to the description, it also supports many current games, although I haven't tested this. The programs I use run very smoothly.

Product Name: Intel Core i5-13600KF Desktop Processor 14 cores (6 P-cores + 8 E-cores) 24M Cache, up to 5.1 GHz' LGA 1700
Review Text: Upgrading to the Intel Core i5-13600KF Desktop Processor from my Ryzen 5800X3D has been a game-changer for my computing experience. This powerhouse of a processor, with its 14 cores (6 P-cores and 8 E-cores) and a substantial 24M cache, has significantly enhanced the performance of my system. The ability of this CPU to turbo up to 5.1 GHz is particularly impressive, contributing to a remarkable improvement in processing speed and overall system responsiveness. Whether I'm running demanding applications, engaging in high-end gaming, or juggling multiple tasks simultaneously, the i5-13600KF handles it all with an ease that is immediately noticeable. The efficiency and speed are especially evident in CPU-intensive tasks, where this processor clearly outshines its predecessor.Beyond just raw performance, what I appreciate about the Intel Core i5-13600KF is its balance between power and efficiency. The division of Performance-cores and Efficiency-cores means that it smartly allocates resources based on the task at hand, ensuring optimal performance without unnecessary power consumption. This aspect is crucial for a balanced system that's powerful yet not overly taxing on energy use. The upgrade process itself was straightforward, and the compatibility with a wide range of motherboards and hardware made the transition smooth. In terms of gaming, the difference is palpable, with smoother frame rates and faster loading times. For creative tasks like video editing and 3D rendering, the performance boost has been equally beneficial, noticeably reducing the time spent on rendering and processing. All in all, the Intel Core i5-13600KF has proven to be an excellent upgrade from the Ryzen 5800X3D, offering a superb blend of performance, efficiency, and versatility. It's a 5-star processor that I'd highly recommend to anyone looking to upgrade their system for an enhanced computing experience.

Product Name: Intel Core i5-13600KF Desktop Processor 14 cores (6 P-cores + 8 E-cores) 24M Cache, up to 5.1 GHz' LGA 1700
Review Text: I won't go into much technical detail here since there's people a lot smarter than myself who can get into the nitty gritty. Generally speaking though - this CPU absolutely smokes, especially for the price. Don't let the 'i5' name fool you. The i5-13600K (and KF) is a top-class processor that for most users, will offer more than enough performance for intensive tasks while having probably the most reasonable power consumption and cooling requirements of the top-three 13th generation Intel processors.I came from an i7-5960X - still a solid processor in this day and age but unfortunately my motherboard wasn't exactly kind to me attempting to take it above 3.8 GHz. Despite it bottlenecking against my 2080 Ti, it still ran cool under a 360mm CLC, topping out at no more than 51 degrees C gaming (GPU load) and 60 degrees under full CPU loads. But since the current market for new components is pretty good, I opted to go all in on a 13th gen build rather than find a better X99 motherboard.Odds are, you're probably going to be cross shopping the i5-13600K with the i7-13700K and the i9-13900K. Unless your workflow necessitates the additional core count or you're chasing records, the performance difference between those CPUs and the 13600K did not seem worth the hundreds of dollars of additional cost and the massive increase in peak power consumption. Power also equals heat, and that was another motivating factor for going with the 13600K, having been accustomed to a relatively cool and quiet build for some time. That said; with the additional cores and much higher boost frequency, I was expecting higher peak power draw and temps despite a lower TDP on paper.And they were definitely higher, under the same 360mm CLC. After running benchmarks with Cinebench and 3DMark, I was hitting peak temps in the mid-to-high 70s under full CPU loads. Gaming loads however were definitely more manageable though, sitting in the 40s and seldom breaking 50 degrees, which was actually a small but appreciable improvement over the 5960X. I'd advise at minimum a high quality air cooler or a 240mm CLC for this processor.The out of the box performance is something else though. I managed to hit 23345 on a multi-core Cinebench test and a 16459 combined score on 3DMark Time Spy. Again, this is stock clocks paired with an overclocked 2080 Ti and 32GB of DDR5 at 5600 MHz. At 3440 x 1440 and 144Hz, games run like butter. I could dabble in overclocking it since I have the headroom but honestly, I don't see the point. It's fantastic as is.All in all, I feel like the 13600K is kind of the no-brainer option for most people looking to put together a high-end system on a budget. You're getting most of the performance of it's more expensive stablemates for a much lower price and less obnoxiously high power and cooling requirements. The KF is also a little cheaper if you don't need integrated graphics. Just buy it. You'll love it.

Review Text: I'm working on upgrading my current build and this was just the thing I needed. So many games run so smoothly with this and it's hard to beat. It hasn't thermal throttled, and I'm sure that's because the stock cooler does the job just fine. It works perfect with a 650 watt 80+ bronze PSU. Do recommend for any mid to high range builds.

Product Name: Intel i5-13400F Desktop Processor 10 cores (6 P-cores + 4 E-cores) 20MB Cache, up to 4.6 GHz
Review Text: Hello,So I bought this processor to replace my ryzen 7 2700x that finally decided to die on me. I have had the ryzen since launch.I was expecting similar performance maybe slightly better. However, this i5-13400f not only performs better than my old ryzen. It also does it at much cooler temps then the ryzen put out. My ryzen idled at 35c and got up to around 79c on heavy load. The i5 idles at 22c and has only gotten as high as 55c max under heavy land. That's 13 degrees cooler than the ryzen at idle and 24 degrees cooler under load.With that said that's a huge improvement over my old ryzen. Which I shouldn't be surprised that ryzen is a few generations old now. But damn. Definitely worth grabbing one.My old ryzen would get bogged down if I created a video game asset in blender around if I went too crazy. So far the i5 hasn't been bothered by anything I do in blender. Or in zbrush, maya, 3ds max, or substance painter.

Review Text: It's a very good processor, I use it for multitasking and it works wonderfully. I can play, record, or stream at the same time without any drop in FPS. The only downside is the stock cooler, which needs to be changed promptly. Initially, the temperature reached up to 100°C while gaming and recording, which is obviously not recommended. Now, with a tower cooler, the temperature stays around 50°C at most.

Product Name: Intel Core i5-13500 Processor, LGA 1700, 24M Cache, up to 4.80 GHz
Review Text:
I recently bought the Intel Core i5-13500 processor, and overall, I am satisfied with its performance. Firstly, this processor offers solid performance for daily tasks and gaming. Single-core performance is good, and its multithreaded capability efficiently handles heavier workloads. I've noticed a significant improvement compared to my old processor, resulting in a smoother and more responsive experience.

However, I must highlight that the price of this processor is somewhat high for the year 2023. With technology evolving rapidly, it's possible to find processors offering similar performance at a lower price. If you're looking for a budget-friendly processor, it might be wise to consider other options on the market.

Additionally, it's important to note that this processor is based on the Alder Lake architecture, which is relatively new. This means there could be compatibility issues or adjustments needed for certain older software or games. Make sure to check compatibility with your setup before purchasing.

In conclusion, the Intel Core i5-13500 processor delivers satisfactory performance for daily tasks and gaming. However, the higher price compared to other market options and potential compatibility issues are factors to consider. If you're willing to invest in a latest-generation processor, this one will meet your performance needs, but exploring other options might offer better value for money.

Product Name: Intel Core i5-13500 Processor, LGA 1700, 24M Cache, up to 4.80 GHz
Review Text: Great cpu for video editing and gaming

Product Name: Intel Core i5-13500 Processor, LGA 1700, 24M Cache, up to 4.80 GHz
Review Text: Processor with a quality-price ratio that shines like Olympus: a beast that tries any application or game or work that you need. Also as temperature we are (if activated in the BIOS the E-CORE starts to heat up ... also if used in a tower heatsink with two fans I have never exceeded 85 degrees, not even in this deep space). Be careful to set the BIOS for this beast, I have written some things to do to avoid problems: 1) pay attention to the CPU power profile, it will be like having a PL1 of 115w and a PL2 of 254w (depends on the producer of the mother board, but good or bad and values ??are these), the processor as it seems... I set the INTEL profile (found among those available in the bios), such as PL1 65w and PL2 154w and testing I reach not to have personal performance in any mode (at most 2/3fps at least but sleep at night the same). 2) IF YOU HAVE AMD GPU: to activate the RESIZABLE BAR in the bios you must first enable the voice ''above 4g decoding'', make the pc always access the bios and then activate the ''resizable bar''... if not, it may happen that the card does not risk applying in contemporary modifications of these two variables will be blocked in a BOOTLOOP (to do this you just need to reset the BIOS by short-circuiting two pins on the motherboard). Otherwise, the excellent CPU is very satisfied.

Be careful to set the BIOS for this beast, I have written some things to do to avoid problems: 1) pay attention to the CPU power profile, it will be like having a PL1 of 115w and a PL2 of 254w (depends on the producer of the mother board, but good or bad and values ??are these), the processor as it seems... I set the INTEL profile (found among those available in the bios), such as PL1 65w and PL2 154w and testing I reach not to have personal performance in any mode (at most 2/3fps at least but sleep at night the same). 2) IF YOU HAVE AMD GPU: to activate the RESIZABLE BAR in the bios you must first enable the voice ''above 4g decoding'', make the pc always access the bios and then activate the ''resizable bar''... if not, it may happen that the card does not risk applying in contemporary modifications of these two variables will be blocked in a BOOTLOOP (to do this you just need to reset the BIOS by short-circuiting two pins on the motherboard). Otherwise, the excellent CPU is very satisfied.

Product Name: Intel Core i5-13500 Processor, LGA 1700, 24M Cache, up to 4.80 GHz
Review Text:
I recently purchased the Intel Core i5-13500 processor, and overall, I am satisfied with its performance. Firstly, this processor offers solid performance for daily tasks and gaming. Single-core performance is good, and its multithreaded capability efficiently handles heavier workloads. I noticed a significant improvement compared to my old processor, resulting in a smoother and more responsive experience.

However, I must point out that the price of this processor is a bit high for 2023. With technology evolving rapidly, it's possible to find processors offering similar performance at a lower price. If you're looking for an economical processor, it might be wise to consider other options in the market.

Additionally, it's important to note that this processor is based on the Alder Lake architecture, which is relatively new. This means there may be compatibility issues or adjustments needed for certain older software or games. Make sure to check compatibility with your setup before purchasing.

In conclusion, the Intel Core i5-13500 processor offers satisfactory performance for daily tasks and gaming. However, the higher price compared to other options on the market and potential compatibility issues are factors to consider. If you're ready to invest in a latest-generation processor, this one will meet your performance needs, but exploring other options may be prudent if you're seeking better value for money.

Review Text: Okay, the Intel i5 13600KF CPU is hidden by its artic watercooling but it is well below.I have this tower to be efficient/versatile/stable and not to cost me an arm ... The i5 13600KF is a nice race beast and you really have to want to start pushing it within these limits.In my personal use it very good and its price remains reasonable.To "tame" the beast a good cooling is essential even if a large radiators/fan is enough, the artic 280 kit that I put is not a luxury given the price (opinion on my other post on the artic freeze III).Good the i5 13600KF is and will remain a moment a reward in quality/price/performance.The eyes closed is happiness.

Review Text: For the fifth time in my life I chose an Intel and I did not make a mistake. I fell by remaining the indisputable need to have adequate cooling, this is a very happy CPU of climbing to clock for its own, boosting on multiples core if necessary or ofConnection with a current thread if it is not doing anything heavy. I promise this I had an i7 7920x and I cried my heart to change it, but all in all after six months, I can't complain about the change.The impression of being drowning in the task holds behind 3080s without effort and I have never had the shadow of the impression that represented a bottleneck. In the definitive, I am satisfied with it.

Review Text: I go from an i9-9900kf with DDR4 3200 MHz to this i7-13700F with DDR5 revenge 7200 MHz 2x16 GB (CMK32GX5M2X7200C34), it is much more efficient, it is at least twice as fast, fluid and active.Everything is stable Grã ¢ this at the Made Mini Itx Asus Rog Stix B760-i Gaming WiFi.My applications open up instantly.The bandwidth moving under AIDA is XXL never seen (more than 100 giga bytes per second).Score of 29,900 under Cinebench R23, and about 29,000 with the skeptuting at 90â ° C Activated in the Bios (very good option not taken of head). Yes was quickly stated in temperatureWinning, under 100% constraint we reach the 100th ° C very quickly, suddenly I assigned a watercooling Cooler Masterliquid Lite 120 to the Silverstone SST-SG13B housing to cool well, to which I replaced theVentilo Stock by two Arctic Bionix P120 fans in push sweater, great refreshing happiness.It really had to be.Idle 32-34 â ° C with an ambient temperature of 18 â ° c.I have a doubt for this elderly.

Product Name: Product Name Not Found
Review Text: ð I start from the conclusions: it is a truly remarkable CPU, I own a pair of 12900k on other builds but this 13700k in some respects is more performing.I am not a player and I use PCs for work.My experience is therefore aimed at professionals who work with videos, photos, 3D reconstructions, 3D editing, photogrammetries etc. etc., unlike the 12900k (on Mobo Asus Proart Z690-Creator WiFi with Deepcool LS720 and Asus Rog Strix Z690-A Gaming WiFi D4 with Itk Evoli 240 Argb both with the Thermalright frame) that mounted without touching the bios do not shoot Watt absurdi (but I think it depends more on the BIOS that from the CPU), this 12700k (on Mobo Asus Proart B760-Creator WiFiWith Noctua NH-D15 Chromax.Black and Frame of Thermalright), he warms a little more. In the 700k compared to 13900k, always reviewed here on Amazon, I didn't want to intervene from the BIOS also because after the first minutes in stress tests, for example with Cinebench 23, during which the Bios always pushes the processor to the limit (over 360 watts), everything calms down.The boost lasts a few moments and immediately after the consumption stands on the 253 watts, consequently the temperatures also drop, so much so that the average ones of the cores hardly exceed 90 degrees (in the 10 min test) â ï¸ the processorIt offers really excellent performances, all programs run smoothly like oil, thanks also to the 64 GB of memory.The Adobe Suite, from Photoshop to After Effects, from Illustrator to Premiere Pro, Blender, 4D Cinema and Metashape Pro (i.e. the programs that I use most) are supported by so much power and have no hesitation.Also with different applications open on 13700K, it works largely .ph on Cinebench R23 the score is 28550 on the single render, maximum temperatures of the core 4, 5 and 7 (the most hot) of 100 ° while in the Throttling test of10 min The score was 27497 with maximum temperatures of 100 ° respectively for Core 3, 5 and 7c.A difference in only 3.69 % between the single render and the Throttling test.Not bad! In the Throttling test of 10 min, the maximum values ​​of the individual cores vary between 93 ° and 100 °, while the average ones between 83 ° -85 °, therefore more than acceptable.The maximum consumption is 351 watts while the average 260 watts. In idle the temperatures vary between 21 ° and 47 °. You can check from the photos ð ost. we now have to the other info: ð shipping: perfect, asThe whole Amazon purchase process.The times have been respected and the packaging was adequate. Oph ¦ Pacco and content: the package, compared to the most famous 13900, is almost poor .. the CPU is located inside a cardboard box protected by the classicplastic houses.The only care is to identify the small triangle on the CPU, at the bottom to the left, and place it in correspondence with the triangle visible on the fixing support of the socket present on the mobo.Personally, to avoid the phenomenon of flexion that can occur on the LGA 1700 socket, I have using the frame of the thermalright.ð ´ useful info: many advise the use of an at least 240 aio, reliable and powerful.This time, however, I wanted to try top of the range heatsink and I must say that it offers no indifferent performances: performances against: -ð ¥ ï¸ The Buildmobo: Asus Proart B760 -CreatorWIFFUPU: Intel I7 13700K With Thermalright LGA1700-BCFCOOLER: Noctua NH-D15 Chromax.Blackram: Corsair Vengeance DDR5 RAM 64GB (2x32GB) 5600MHz CL40SSD System: Crucial P5 Plus 2TB SSDGPU: NVIDIA RTX A4000 16 850E (2023) Houses:Fractal Design North Charcoal Black Tempered Glass Dark

Product Name: IntelÂ® Core i3-10100 Processor (6M Cache, up to 4.30 GHz) BGA 437 Socket
Review Text: I've had many different processors in the past. I find this 10100 one in particular, to give me the biggest bang for my buck! You have to spend quite a bit more to get more performance, and even then you'd only get like 15 to 25% more. The performance per CPU of this beauty is fantastic, plus you get more than ample performance when running many threads.

Product Name: IntelÂ® Core i3-10100 Processor (6M Cache, up to 4.30 GHz) BGA 437 Socket
Review Text: I have pc gaming, I come from an ugly pentium 4600 processor, who ran the games, but even there, it is all that he did, I could not do anything more than play and already, I could not do streaming, I could not enter discord to talkOr be in communication, nothing, I had to do one thing at the same time, I bought this processor ... and literal, the beginning of 25 seconds to 6.5 seconds (yes, it is a lot of difference) and now I can do streaming and be in discordWhile playing without problems or anything, super powerful to be an i3 and run the games in 60fps without problems at full HD (I have a 1050i nvidia)

Product Name: IntelÂ® Core i3-10100 Processor (6M Cache, up to 4.30 GHz) BGA 437 Socket
Review Text: DISCLAIMER: This review covers 3 main items (CPU, MOBO, RAM). Links to the other parts are included (all available at Amazon for good prices). You'll read this review on each of the other parts as well.WHY DID I BUY IT? I recently built and absolute beast of a computer and kept my older one as a backup. Unfortunately, it decided to take a dive this past week with the motherboard failing catastropically. Given that it was 10 years old, I decided to replace the "brains" with something a little more modern, but not overkill. Because I had spent a LOT of money on a computer recently, I was trying to keep the repair under about $400 and here's what I did...The BRAINS...Intel i3-10100 Processor ($100): www.amazon.com/gp/product/B086MMRW87MSI Mag B460 Motherboard ($110): www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08GXVP1DMTeamGroup 16GB DDR4 ($60): www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07WNQVBZ6*** These are the main parts that MUST be compatible.. and they are ***I was worried about my hard drive, so I went ahead and splurged on a TeamGroup 1TB SSD ($75 -- www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07PX2KKHM) bringing my total to just under $400. I could have kept my old Seagate 500gb 5400 RPM drive but I had a little extra to spend and that greatly sped up boot and wait times.For what it's worth, I also kept my existing Antec Power Supply (550W) that was replaced about a year ago, my case, and my now very old graphics card (R9 380 - 4gb). I already had a good monitor, mouse, and keyboard so those carried over as well.So how did it go together? Pretty seamlessly with just 2 little hiccups.HICCUP #1RAM: I did not realize the motherboard I purchased has a standard RAM speed of 2666. It can get up to a max of 2933. So the RAM I purchased (3200 speed, CL 16) is overkill and I could have saved another $20 or so. But, I didn't... and it's my first build with TeamGroup RAM and I'm happy with it.HICCUP #2LAN/AUDIO: Once I got everything installed, the LAN would not connect to my network (wired, ethernet connection). A little troubleshooting found out YOU MUST TO UPGRADE THE LAN DRIVER for it to work. This means having another computer with internet and a flash drive. Likewise, I went ahead and updated the Audio driver and the sound was much crisper. So... take a moment and download all of the drivers in advance from the MSI website.FIRST POWER ON: The computer started up, then turned off immediately. It then restarted on it's own and said the motherboard had detected changes so I needed to configure the BIOS. Entering BIOS found that everything was recognized. So I changed the first boot device to USB flash drive and plugged in my Windows 10 install flash drive and restarted.Bottom Line: The Intel i3-10100 is a great little chip (not overclockable). The MSI 460 Torpedo is a decent motherboard (just update the LAN and Audio drivers) that boots quickly. In fact, it boots so quickly, I don't even see the POST screen. From cold to Windows is easily under 30 seconds.The RAM is stable at 2666 and fast enough that I probably won't even push the 2933 setting. The SSD is very fast (functionally almost as fast as the M2 drive I have in my beast at a savings of $20-25). Even with the aging R9 graphics card, I'm easily hitting 60 FPS on modern titles at 1080 in medium to high settings. Sometime next year when graphics card prices drop to a reasonable level, I'll update that and have a second gaming rig ready.Overall, I'm very happy with this setup.

Product Name: IntelÂ® Core i3-10100 Processor (6M Cache, up to 4.30 GHz) BGA 437 Socket
Review Text: Paid 125 euros.A bomb!Entry Level Quad Core, new Chispet LGA 1200. Intel, with this range, made a nice leap forward and on the entry level market it was definitely placed in front of the dear old Ryzen.I built a Build for domestic/small office with a few hundred euros, and the result was more than excellent! I remember that for those who are looking for a decent build (not devoted to gaming) this is an excellentchoice, also considering the integrated graphics that saves on the video card.And for those who want to take a little playful moment, here Fortnite and similar titles do not struggle. The only flaw (but the period is what it is) is that there are few LGA 1200 mothers at a consonation price.

Pretty seamlessly with just 2 little hiccups.HICCUP #1RAM: I did not realize the motherboard I purchased has a standard RAM speed of 2666. It can get up to a max of 2933. So the RAM I purchased (3200 speed, CL 16) is overkill and I could have saved another $20 or so. But, I didn't... and it's my first build with TeamGroup RAM and I'm happy with it.HICCUP #2LAN/AUDIO: Once I got everything installed, the LAN would not connect to my network (wired, ethernet connection). A little troubleshooting found out YOU MUST TO UPGRADE THE LAN DRIVER for it to work. This means having another computer with internet and a flash drive. Likewise, I went ahead and updated the Audio driver and the sound was much crisper. So... take a moment and download all of the drivers in advance from the MSI website.FIRST POWER ON: The computer started up, then turned off immediately. It then restarted on it's own and said the motherboard had detected changes so I needed to configure the BIOS. Entering BIOS found that everything was recognized. So I changed the first boot device to USB flash drive and plugged in my Windows 10 install flash drive and restarted.Bottom Line: The Intel i3-10100 is a great little chip (not overclockable). The MSI 460 Torpedo is a decent motherboard (just update the LAN and Audio drivers) that boots quickly. In fact, it boots so quickly, I don't even see the POST screen. From cold to Windows is easily under 30 seconds.The RAM is stable at 2666 and fast enough that I probably won't even push the 2933 setting. The SSD is very fast (functionally almost as fast as the M2 drive I have in my beast at a savings of $20-25). Even with the aging R9 graphics card, I'm easily hitting 60 FPS on modern titles at 1080 in medium to high settings. Sometime next year when graphics card prices drop to a reasonable level, I'll update that and have a second gaming rig ready.Overall, I'm very happy with this setup.

Product Name: IntelÂ® Core i3-10100 Processor (6M Cache, up to 4.30 GHz) BGA 437 Socket
Review Text: Paid 125 euros.A bomb!Entry Level Quad Core, new Chispet LGA 1200. Intel, with this range, made a nice leap forward and on the entry level market it was definitely placed in front of the dear old Ryzen.I built a Build for domestic/small office with a few hundred euros, and the result was more than excellent! I remember that for those who are looking for a decent build (not devoted to gaming) this is an excellentchoice, also considering the integrated graphics that saves on the video card.And for those who want to take a little playful moment, here Fortnite and similar titles do not struggle. The only flaw (but the period is what it is) is that there are few LGA 1200 mothers at a consonation price.

Product Name: IntelÂ® Core i3-12100 Processor 12M Cache, up to 4.30 GHz LGA1700 Socket
Review Text: The Intel Core i3-12100 processor from the 12th generation brings a breath of fresh air to compact NAS systems.As an entry-level chip of the current Alder Lake architecture, it not only offers sufficient computing power for demanding server tasks, but also convinces with a very efficient energy balance. The modern hybrid design made of four performance and four efficiency cores enables an ever balanced operation.Demanding tasks such as video transcoding, multitasking or containerization are approved by the fast P-cores with a high clock rate.The i3-12100 offers enormous performance reserves for computing power reserves for computing NAS workloads such as video streaming, multimediaservices or data backup tasks for less complex background processes.The modern Skylake architecture and 12MB intelligent cache accelerate the data surveys too.This significantly reduces the operating costs and levy load on the NAS. The Core i3-12100 proves to be a change-fitting performance bringer for demanding home users and semi-professional-NAS systems.The perfect combination of modern functions, power and efficiency at a very attractive price.

Product Name: IntelÂ® Core i3-12100 Processor 12M Cache, up to 4.30 GHz LGA1700 Socket
Review Text: Quiet processor for office. With a base power of 6OW and turbo of 89W the CPU is silent. It is obvious that if you make it go to 100 percent in Multy Core the stock fan a little feels but, to mineAcceptable notice. With Cinebench 2024 I reached 60 degrees max with an HTPC case (not exceptional Air flow) and I would say excellent!

Product Name: IntelÂ® Core i3-12100 Processor 12M Cache, up to 4.30 GHz LGA1700 Socket
Review Text: The Intel Core i3-12100 processor from the 12th generation brings a breath of fresh air to compact NAS systems.As an entry-level chip of the current Alder Lake architecture, it not only offers sufficient computing power for demanding server tasks, but also convinces with a very efficient energy balance. The modern hybrid design made of four performance and four efficiency cores enables an ever balanced operation.Demanding tasks such as video transcoding, multitasking or containerization are approved by the fast P-cores with a high clock rate.The i3-12100 offers enormous performance reserves for computing power reserves for computing NAS workloads such as video streaming, multimediaservices or data backup tasks for less complex background processes.The modern Skylake architecture and 12MB intelligent cache accelerate the data surveys too.This significantly reduces the operating costs and levy load on the NAS. The Core i3-12100 proves to be a change-fitting performance bringer for demanding home users and semi-professional-NAS systems.The perfect combination of modern functions, power and efficiency at a very attractive price.

Product Name: IntelÂ® Core i3-12100 Processor 12M Cache, up to 4.30 GHz LGA1700 Socket
Review Text: Quiet processor for office. With a base power of 6OW and turbo of 89W the CPU is silent. It is obvious that if you make it go to 100 percent in Multy Core the stock fan a little feels but, to mineAcceptable notice. With Cinebench 2024 I reached 60 degrees max with an HTPC case (not exceptional Air flow) and I would say excellent!

Review Text: The processor was very power efficient i develop android apps and web development and for this the processor was beast and I do some little gaming with rx580 which combination was superb  with 5400mhz ddr5 memory 1 tb ssd . . .

Product Name: Intel Core I5 12400F 12 Gen Generation Desktop Pc Processor 6, Cpu with 18Mb Cache and Up to 4.40 Ghz Clock Speed Ddr5 and Ddr4 Ram Support Lga 1700 Socket, Micro Atx
Review Text: This processor is great mid to high range budget builds, if your looking for a cpu for around 10K INR, this is the perfect choice, it has 6 Cores and 12 Threads which is quite powerful. For me, pairing it with RX 6600 gave me around 120 FPS in almost all games while playing on High Graphics. About the stock cooler, the stock cooler can definitely keep the heat away, i experienced less than 60Â° while gaming, although u can go for a better cooler if u prefer that, but the stock cooler will do its job.Overall 9.5/10 product.

Product Name: Intel Core I5 12400F 12 Gen Generation Desktop Pc Processor 6, Cpu with 18Mb Cache and Up to 4.40 Ghz Clock Speed Ddr5 and Ddr4 Ram Support Lga 1700 Socket, Micro Atx
Review Text: I recently purchased an i5 processor from Amazon, and unfortunately, it turned out to be defective. Despite my efforts to seek assistance from Amazon, their customer support proved unhelpful, leaving me frustrated with my hard-earned money seemingly down the drain. Disappointed with both the product and the lack of support, I advise potential buyers to exercise caution when considering this purchase.

Product Name: Intel Core I5 12400F 12 Gen Generation Desktop Pc Processor 6, Cpu with 18Mb Cache and Up to 4.40 Ghz Clock Speed Ddr5 and Ddr4 Ram Support Lga 1700 Socket, Micro Atx
Review Text: I upgrade from 9400f. The performance gain is a huge. I use cooler master hyper 212 with this and my cbinet have 3 intake 2 exhaust fan, Temp never cross 60Â°c even when full load stress test. The efficiency of this processor is incredible runs below 1.2 volt. It never reach 1.2v even when doing Multi core stress test.If you're building mid range PC for gaming purpose this is the cpu you should consider. At this price point there's nothing that can beat this processor.

Product Name: Intel Core I5 12400F 12 Gen Generation Desktop Pc Processor 6, Cpu with 18Mb Cache and Up to 4.40 Ghz Clock Speed Ddr5 and Ddr4 Ram Support Lga 1700 Socket, Micro Atx
Review Text: Switched from 6th gen i5 (6600k) to 12400f, I can feel the significant improvement. Especially with daily tasks and games it works perfectly. I got ddr5 6000mhz cl30 ram as well, works without a problem. Combined with 4060 ti, consumes such little power and gets everything i need done so far.I got a noctua cooler for it though, works really quiet and cool. Perfect for the price. About 500sek cheaper than the version with integrated graphics, but there are low profile gpus in case you want it as a simple daily or office use.

Product Name: Intel Core I5 12400F 12 Gen Generation Desktop Pc Processor 6, Cpu with 18Mb Cache and Up to 4.40 Ghz Clock Speed Ddr5 and Ddr4 Ram Support Lga 1700 Socket, Micro Atx
Review Text: I upgrade from 9400f. The performance gain is a huge. I use cooler master hyper 212 with this and my cbinet have 3 intake 2 exhaust fan, Temp never cross 60Â°c even when full load stress test. The efficiency of this processor is incredible runs below 1.2 volt. It never reach 1.2v even when doing Multi core stress test.If you're building mid range PC for gaming purpose this is the cpu you should consider. At this price point there's nothing that can beat this processor.

Product Name: Intel Core I5 12400F 12 Gen Generation Desktop Pc Processor 6, Cpu with 18Mb Cache and Up to 4.40 Ghz Clock Speed Ddr5 and Ddr4 Ram Support Lga 1700 Socket, Micro Atx
Review Text: Switched from 6th gen i5 (6600k) to 12400f, I can feel the significant improvement. Especially with daily tasks and games it works perfectly. I got ddr5 6000mhz cl30 ram as well, works without a problem. Combined with 4060 ti, consumes such little power and gets everything i need done so far.I got a noctua cooler for it though, works really quiet and cool. Perfect for the price. About 500sek cheaper than the version with integrated graphics, but there are low profile gpus in case you want it as a simple daily or office use.

Product Name: Intel Core I5 12400F 12 Gen Generation Desktop Pc Processor 6, Cpu with 18Mb Cache and Up to 4.40 Ghz Clock Speed Ddr5 and Ddr4 Ram Support Lga 1700 Socket, Micro Atx
Review Text: This processor is great mid to high range budget builds, if your looking for a cpu for around 10K INR, this is the perfect choice, it has 6 Cores and 12 Threads which is quite powerful. For me, pairing it with RX 6600 gave me around 120 FPS in almost all games while playing on High Graphics. About the stock cooler, the stock cooler can definitely keep the heat away, i experienced less than 60Â° while gaming, although u can go for a better cooler if u prefer that, but the stock cooler will do its job.Overall 9.5/10 product.

Product Name: Intel Core I5 12400F 12 Gen Generation Desktop Pc Processor 6, Cpu with 18Mb Cache and Up to 4.40 Ghz Clock Speed Ddr5 and Ddr4 Ram Support Lga 1700 Socket, Micro Atx
Review Text: Switched from 6th gen i5 (6600k) to 12400f, I can feel the significant improvement. Especially with daily tasks and games it works perfectly. I got ddr5 6000mhz cl30 ram as well, works without a problem. Combined with 4060 ti, consumes such little power and gets everything i need done so far.I got a noctua cooler for it though, works really quiet and cool. Perfect for the price. About 500sek cheaper than the version with integrated graphics, but there are low profile gpus in case you want it as a simple daily or office use.

Product Name: Intel Core I5 12400F 12 Gen Generation Desktop Pc Processor 6, Cpu with 18Mb Cache and Up to 4.40 Ghz Clock Speed Ddr5 and Ddr4 Ram Support Lga 1700 Socket, Micro Atx
Review Text: Due to my old i5 8400 a world of difference.Everything no longer charges delays anymore.In combination with an RX 6600 as good as all games at 1080p on at least 75fps.

Product Name: Intel Core I5 12400F 12 Gen Generation Desktop Pc Processor 6, Cpu with 18Mb Cache and Up to 4.40 Ghz Clock Speed Ddr5 and Ddr4 Ram Support Lga 1700 Socket, Micro Atx
Review Text: The processor was very power efficient i develop android apps and web development and for this the processor was beast and I do some little gaming with rx580 which combination was superb  with 5400mhz ddr5 memory 1 tb ssd . . .

Product Name: Intel Core I5 12400F 12 Gen Generation Desktop Pc Processor 6, Cpu with 18Mb Cache and Up to 4.40 Ghz Clock Speed Ddr5 and Ddr4 Ram Support Lga 1700 Socket, Micro Atx
Review Text: This processor is great mid to high range budget builds, if your looking for a cpu for around 10K INR, this is the perfect choice, it has 6 Cores and 12 Threads which is quite powerful. For me, pairing it with RX 6600 gave me around 120 FPS in almost all games while playing on High Graphics. About the stock cooler, the stock cooler can definitely keep the heat away, i experienced less than 60Â° while gaming, although u can go for a better cooler if u prefer that, but the stock cooler will do its job.Overall 9.5/10 product.

Product Name: Intel Core I5 12400F 12 Gen Generation Desktop Pc Processor 6, Cpu with 18Mb Cache and Up to 4.40 Ghz Clock Speed Ddr5 and Ddr4 Ram Support Lga 1700 Socket, Micro Atx
Review Text: I recently purchased an i5 processor from Amazon, and unfortunately, it turned out to be defective. Despite my efforts to seek assistance from Amazon, their customer support proved unhelpful, leaving me frustrated with my hard-earned money seemingly down the drain. Disappointed with both the product and the lack of support, I advise potential buyers to exercise caution when considering this purchase.

Product Name: Intel Core I5 12400F 12 Gen Generation Desktop Pc Processor 6, Cpu with 18Mb Cache and Up to 4.40 Ghz Clock Speed Ddr5 and Ddr4 Ram Support Lga 1700 Socket, Micro Atx
Review Text: I upgrade from 9400f. The performance gain is a huge. I use cooler master hyper 212 with this and my cbinet have 3 intake 2 exhaust fan, Temp never cross 60Â°c even when full load stress test. The efficiency of this processor is incredible runs below 1.2 volt. It never reach 1.2v even when doing Multi core stress test.If you're building mid range PC for gaming purpose this is the cpu you should consider. At this price point there's nothing that can beat this processor.

Review Text: Nice CPU. This replaces my old 4790K pc, and what an amazing difference and a pleasant surprise performance-wise! It runs cool (64 degrees) during stress tests and gaming, and it is stable to 5.1 GHz. Haven't tried to push it, but have little doubt there is sufficient headroom to OC further. This has turned out to be an outstanding CPU. I recommend this CPU to anyone interested in a low-cost, low-heat, and stable performance.

Product Name: Intel Core i5 12600K 12 Gen Generation Desktop PC Processor CPU with 20MB Cache and up to 4.90 GHz Clock Speed 3 Years Warranty with Fan LGA 1700 Socket No Graphic Card Required
Review Text: Good middle class CPU.Price-performance OK

Product Name: Intel Core i5 12600K 12 Gen Generation Desktop PC Processor CPU with 20MB Cache and up to 4.90 GHz Clock Speed 3 Years Warranty with Fan LGA 1700 Socket No Graphic Card Required
Review Text: This seems like a good CPU so far but it was packaged very poorly - the chip was literally rattling around loose inside the Amazon box. I found a small roll of bubble wrap that was presumably lightly taped around it when it was first put into the box. There was no plastic clam-shell cover, no anti-static bag, and no Intel product box. It was not listed here as used, b-stock, or otherwise, but even if it had been this packaging would not be acceptable. The price I paid was certainly for a new i5-12600K in any case.If I were not so far away (Ireland), I would have returned it on principle, but I don't want to have to wait for a replacement unless I have no choice. It probably says something about the robustness of the chip that it's still working okay with no obvious issues after a couple of weeks of moderate use.

Product Name: Intel Core i5 12600K 12 Gen Generation Desktop PC Processor CPU with 20MB Cache and up to 4.90 GHz Clock Speed 3 Years Warranty with Fan LGA 1700 Socket No Graphic Card Required
Review Text: Processor received in any cardboard box.Used processor sold as new.I don't have time for a return but a commercial gesture would be welcome.

Product Name: Intel Core i5 12600K 12 Gen Generation Desktop PC Processor CPU with 20MB Cache and up to 4.90 GHz Clock Speed 3 Years Warranty with Fan LGA 1700 Socket No Graphic Card Required
Review Text: Good middle class CPU.Price-performance OK

Product Name: Intel Core i5 12600K 12 Gen Generation Desktop PC Processor CPU with 20MB Cache and up to 4.90 GHz Clock Speed 3 Years Warranty with Fan LGA 1700 Socket No Graphic Card Required
Review Text: This seems like a good CPU so far but it was packaged very poorly - the chip was literally rattling around loose inside the Amazon box. I found a small roll of bubble wrap that was presumably lightly taped around it when it was first put into the box. There was no plastic clam-shell cover, no anti-static bag, and no Intel product box. It was not listed here as used, b-stock, or otherwise, but even if it had been this packaging would not be acceptable. The price I paid was certainly for a new i5-12600K in any case.If I were not so far away (Ireland), I would have returned it on principle, but I don't want to have to wait for a replacement unless I have no choice. It probably says something about the robustness of the chip that it's still working okay with no obvious issues after a couple of weeks of moderate use.
